properties.abstract: Piz Terri: many hikers consider the pyramidal summit with its euphonic name their dream destination. It is not only Piz Terri that attracts hikers, but also the plain below, Plaun da Greina, which for many is a romantic place of yearning. It is not recommended to limit a visit to such an interesting region to one day as there are other summits in the environs also worth visiting.
properties.subtitle: Terribly beautiful!
properties.title: From Terrihütte SAC to Capanna Motterascio CAS

sac_photos.title: Just a few meters to Piz Terri.
View from the summit to the ascent and the descent.

Look back shortly before the chimney.
The chimney up to the SW-Ridge.
Typical terrain in the summit flank.
Typical terrain in the summit flank.
On Plaun da Greina: what a pretty start to a tour!
Piz Terri viewed from the north; the ascent is on the right shore of the lake and then follows the ridge to the left.

segments.description: From Terrihütte take the mountain hiking trail to the east and cross the new suspension bridge atl P. 2193. Traverse Plaun da Greina southward on a mountain hiking trail. Then turn left (east) to enter Val Canal on a faint path.
segments.title: Terrihütte - bifurcation Val Canal

segments.description: At first ascend on the north bank of the creek, then cross the creek at ca. 2340 m to reach on grass and scree (path)  the south-west shore of Lageth la Greina on the map). On this shore hike to the end of the lake and enter a small valley leading to the (dwindling) Glatscher dil Terri. Go southward on slippery scree, bypass P. 2748 on the north side to reach the saddle at 2745 m (slabs of rock erected). Now follow the slipperly alpine hiking trail to the western ridge, overcoming a scrambling passage (not exposed) in a chimney shortly before P. 2898. A few metres to the right of the ridge line there is a faint path on the steep slope leading up to the summit.
segments.title: Val Canal - Terri-See - Piz Terri

segments.description: Descend on the ascent as far as the saddle, then follow the alpine hiking trail to Capanna Motterascio.
segments.title: Piz Terri - Capanna Motterascio.
